page.title: 12Farming around Edingale
page.content: All the land in our project block is intensively farmed.The vast majority of the land is under arable crops but a few of the farmers keep small herds of cattle for milk and a few have flocks of sheep. Nearly all the land in the block is farmed by six farmers and also there are eight County Council smallholdings up Pessall Lane.One farmer works about 750 acres in the centre of the block. He grows wheat, barley, oil-seed rape and horse beans, with the help of his two sons and one other employee, and three tractors.About 250 acres of the land owned by another farm falls in our block.Most of this is under cereals. Sometimes the farmers are unable to do all the harvesting themselves and so they hire contractors.The Grange farm also fatten bull calves and keep sheep.
